title: Fiat Chrysler Manager Charged in Diesel Emissions Scandal
text:
Federal prosecutors have filed charges against a senior manager at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV for allegedly misleading regulators about the level of tailpipe emissions from the company’s vehicles, according to court documents unsealed Tuesday.

Emanuele Palma, a diesel-calibration manager at the car maker, and unnamed co-conspirators are alleged to have rigged the diesel-emissions systems on models manufactured by Fiat Chrysler to help them cheat on federal tests, according to a grand jury indictment from Sept. 18.
